defined.name: axis_member
defined.documentation:
Description of a given ensemble member. It will normally be related to a specific
    ensemble requirement. Note that start dates can be extracted directly from the simulations
    and do not need to be recorded with an axis member description.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Description of the member (or name of parameter varied).

defined.name: extra_detail
defined.documentation: If necessary: further information about ensemble member conformance.

defined.name: index
defined.documentation: The ensemble member index.

defined.name: target_requirement
defined.documentation: URI of the target numerical requirement, if any.

defined.name: value
defined.documentation: If parameter varied, value thereof for this member.

defined.name: conformance
defined.documentation:
A specific conformance. Describes how a particular numerical requirement has been implemented.
    Will normally be linked from an ensemble descriptor.

defined.name: conformance_achieved
defined.documentation: Summary of conformance status.

enumeration_members.documentation: Simulation (or ensemble) conformed to requirement
Simulation (or ensemble) partially conformed to requirement - details in description
Simulation (or ensemble) was unable to conform to requirement
Requirement is not relevant

defined.name: datasets
defined.documentation: The datasets (including any modifications made to them) used for conforming to the target requirement.

defined.name: models
defined.documentation: The models to which this conformance applies.

defined.name: target_requirement
defined.documentation: URI of the target numerical requirement.

defined.name: alternative_names
defined.documentation: List of names by which the activity is also known.

defined.name: canonical_name
defined.documentation: Community defined identifier or name.

defined.name: citations
defined.documentation: Set of pertinent citations.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

defined.name: duration
defined.documentation: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

defined.name: internal_name
defined.documentation: A name used for internal purposes.

defined.name: keywords
defined.documentation: User defined keywords.

defined.name: long_name
defined.documentation: Longer version of activity name.

defined.name: meta
defined.documentation: Injected document metadata.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Short name or abbreviation.

defined.name: previously_known_as
defined.documentation: List of names by which the activity was formerly known.

defined.name: rationale
defined.documentation: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

defined.name: responsible_parties
defined.documentation: People or organisations responsible for activity.

defined.name: ensemble
defined.documentation:
Generic ensemble definition.
    Holds the definition of how the various ensemble members have been configured.
    If ensemble axes are not present, then this is either a single member ensemble,
    or part of an uber ensemble.

defined.name: common_conformances
defined.documentation: Conformance documents for requirements common across ensemble.

defined.name: documentation
defined.documentation: Links to web-pages and other ensemble specific documentation (including workflow descriptions).

defined.name: ensemble_axes
defined.documentation: Set of axes for the ensemble.

defined.name: experiments
defined.documentation: Experiments with which the ensemble is associated (may differ from constituent simulations).

defined.name: members
defined.documentation: The set of ensemble members.

defined.name: representative_performance
defined.documentation: Representative model performance across ensemble.

defined.name: uber_ensembles
defined.documentation: Link to one or more over-arching ensembles that might includes this one.

defined.name: alternative_names
defined.documentation: List of names by which the activity is also known.

defined.name: canonical_name
defined.documentation: Community defined identifier or name.

defined.name: citations
defined.documentation: Set of pertinent citations.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

defined.name: duration
defined.documentation: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

defined.name: internal_name
defined.documentation: A name used for internal purposes.

defined.name: keywords
defined.documentation: User defined keywords.

defined.name: long_name
defined.documentation: Longer version of activity name.

defined.name: meta
defined.documentation: Injected document metadata.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Short name or abbreviation.

defined.name: previously_known_as
defined.documentation: List of names by which the activity was formerly known.

defined.name: rationale
defined.documentation: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

defined.name: responsible_parties
defined.documentation: People or organisations responsible for activity.

defined.name: ensemble_axis
defined.documentation: Defines the meaning of r/i/p indices in an ensemble.

defined.name: extra_detail
defined.documentation: Any extra detail required to describe how this ensemble axis was delivered.

defined.name: member
defined.documentation: Individual member descriptions along axis.

defined.name: short_identifier
defined.documentation: e.g. 'r', 'i', 'p' or 'f' to conform with simulation ensemble variant identifiers.

defined.name: target_requirement
defined.documentation: URI of the target numerical requirement, if any

defined.name: ensemble_member
defined.documentation:
An ensemble may be a complicated interplay of axes, for example, r/i/p, not all of which
    are populated, so we need a list of the actual simulations and how they map onto the ensemble
    axes.

defined.name: errata
defined.documentation: Link to errata associated with this simulation.

defined.name: had_performance
defined.documentation: Performance of the simulation.

defined.name: ran_on
defined.documentation: The machine on which the simulation was run.

defined.name: simulation
defined.documentation: Actual simulation description for an ensemble member. The variant id is in the simuluation document.

defined.name: parent_simulation
defined.documentation: Defines the relationship between a simulation and its parent.

defined.name: branch_method
defined.documentation: Description of how the simulation was branched from a parent simualtion, e.g. 'standard', 'none provided'.

defined.name: branch_time_in_child
defined.documentation: The time at which the present simulation started in the child calendar.

defined.name: branch_time_in_parent
defined.documentation: The time in parent simulation calendar at which this simulation was branched.

defined.name: parent
defined.documentation: The parent simulation of this child.

defined.name: uber_ensemble
defined.documentation:
An ensemble made up of other ensembles. Often used where parts of an ensemble were run by
    different institutes. Could also be used when a new experiment is designed which can use
    ensemble members from previous experiments and/or projects.

defined.name: child_ensembles
defined.documentation: Ensemble which are aggregated into this one.

defined.name: common_conformances
defined.documentation: Conformance documents for requirements common across ensemble.

defined.name: documentation
defined.documentation: Links to web-pages and other ensemble specific documentation (including workflow descriptions).

defined.name: ensemble_axes
defined.documentation: Set of axes for the ensemble.

defined.name: experiments
defined.documentation: Experiments with which the ensemble is associated (may differ from constituent simulations).

defined.name: members
defined.documentation: The set of ensemble members.

defined.name: representative_performance
defined.documentation: Representative model performance across ensemble.

defined.name: uber_ensembles
defined.documentation: Link to one or more over-arching ensembles that might includes this one.

defined.name: alternative_names
defined.documentation: List of names by which the activity is also known.

defined.name: canonical_name
defined.documentation: Community defined identifier or name.

defined.name: citations
defined.documentation: Set of pertinent citations.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Description of what is to be done (or was done).

defined.name: duration
defined.documentation: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

defined.name: internal_name
defined.documentation: A name used for internal purposes.

defined.name: keywords
defined.documentation: User defined keywords.

defined.name: long_name
defined.documentation: Longer version of activity name.

defined.name: meta
defined.documentation: Injected document metadata.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Short name or abbreviation.

defined.name: previously_known_as
defined.documentation: List of names by which the activity was formerly known.

defined.name: rationale
defined.documentation: Explanation of why this activity was carried out and/or what it was intended to achieve.

defined.name: responsible_parties
defined.documentation: People or organisations responsible for activity.

defined.name: dataset
defined.documentation: Dataset discovery information.

defined.name: availability
defined.documentation: Where the data is located, and how it is accessed.

defined.name: citations
defined.documentation: Set of pertinent citations.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Textural description of dataset.

defined.name: drs_datasets
defined.documentation: Data available in the DRS.

defined.name: meta
defined.documentation: Injected document metadata.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Name of dataset.

defined.name: produced_by
defined.documentation: Makes a link back to originating activity.

defined.name: related_to_dataset
defined.documentation: Related dataset.

defined.name: responsible_parties
defined.documentation: Individuals and organisations reponsible for the data.

defined.name: downscaling
defined.documentation: Defines a downscaling activity.

defined.name: downscaled_from
defined.documentation: The simulation that was downscaled by this downscaling activity.

defined.name: calendar
defined.documentation: The calendar used in the simulation

defined.name: end_time
defined.documentation: The start date-time of the simulation. e.g. 2087-11-30 12:00:00

defined.name: extra_attributes
defined.documentation: Additional attributes provided with simulation.

defined.name: forcing_index
defined.documentation: index for variant of forcing, e.g. 2

defined.name: further_info_url
defined.documentation: On-line location of documentation

defined.name: initialization_index
defined.documentation: Index variant of initialization method, e.g. 1

defined.name: insitution
defined.documentation: institution which carried out the simulation

defined.name: parent_simulation
defined.documentation: If appropriate, detailed information about how this simulation branched from a previous one

defined.name: part_of_project
defined.documentation: Project or projects for which simulation was run

defined.name: physics_index
defined.documentation: index for model physics, e.g. 3

defined.name: primary_ensemble
defined.documentation: Primary Ensemble (ensemble for which this simulation was first run).

defined.name: ran_for_experiments
defined.documentation: One or more experiments with which the simulation is associated

defined.name: realization_index
defined.documentation: realization number, e.g. 5

defined.name: start_time
defined.documentation: The start date-time of the simulation. e.g. 2012-04-01 00:00:00

defined.name: sub_experiment
defined.documentation: For start-date ensembles, this will indicate the beginning year; for offline models driven by output from another model, this will provide the source_id and variant_label for the 'driving' model.

defined.name: used
defined.documentation: The model used to run the simulation

defined.name: variant_info
defined.documentation: description of run variant differences, e.g. forcing: black carbon aerosol only

defined.name: alternative_names
defined.documentation: List of names by which the activity is also known.

defined.name: canonical_name
defined.documentation: Community defined identifier or name.

defined.documentation: Set of pertinent citations.

defined.name: input_dataset
defined.documentation:
An input dataset is used as within another component (such as a
model). It comprises an original, source dataset plus any
modifications requirted to use it in the relevant component.

defined.name: modifications_applied
defined.documentation: Describe modifications (if any) applied to the dataset prior to use. E.g. spatial interpolation, temporal averaging, etc.

defined.name: original_data
defined.documentation: The source dataset, prior to any modifications

defined.name: simulation
defined.documentation:
Simulation class provides the integrating link about what models
    were run and wny.  In many cases this should be auto-generated
    from output file headers.

defined.name: calendar
defined.documentation: The calendar used in the simulation

defined.name: end_time
defined.documentation: The start date-time of the simulation. e.g. 2087-11-30 12:00:00

defined.name: extra_attributes
defined.documentation: Additional attributes provided with simulation.

defined.name: forcing_index
defined.documentation: index for variant of forcing, e.g. 2

defined.name: further_info_url
defined.documentation: On-line location of documentation

defined.name: initialization_index
defined.documentation: Index variant of initialization method, e.g. 1

defined.documentation: institution which carried out the simulation

defined.name: parent_simulation
defined.documentation: If appropriate, detailed information about how this simulation branched from a previous one

defined.name: part_of_project
defined.documentation: Project or projects for which simulation was run

defined.name: physics_index
defined.documentation: index for model physics, e.g. 3

defined.documentation: Primary Ensemble (ensemble for which this simulation was first run).

defined.documentation: description of run variant differences, e.g. forcing: black carbon aerosol only

defined.name: variable_collection
defined.documentation: A collection of variables within the scope of a code or process element.

defined.name: collection_name
defined.documentation: Name for this variable collection.

defined.name: variables
defined.documentation: Set of variable names.

defined.name: axis_member
defined.documentation: PLACEHOLDER for the real axis_member.

defined.name: domain_requirements
defined.documentation: Properties of the domain which needs to be simulated, extent and/or resolution.

defined.name: required_extent
defined.documentation: Constraint on extent of domain to be simulated.

defined.name: required_resolution
defined.documentation: Constraint on resolution required in simulated domain.

defined.name: additional_requirements
defined.documentation: Additional detail for this requirement.

defined.name: is_conformance_info_required
defined.documentation: Indicator as to whether an institute is expected to provide informationas to how it confirmed.

defined.name: is_conformance_requested
defined.documentation: Indicator as to whether ensemble documentation should include conformance information for this requirement.

defined.name: scope
defined.documentation: Scope allows us to categorise a requirement in terms of how widely it is shared.

enumeration_members.documentation: MIP era wide e.g. 'concentration of pre-industrial CO2' & 'Impose AMIP SSTs'
Shared across a group of MIPs e.g. aerosol forcing in GeoMIP and AerChemMIP.
Shared within a single MIP e.g. spin-up protocol for land surface experiments in LUMIP.
Applies to a single experiment e.g. CFMIP 'zonally uniform SST plus 4K'

defined.name: ensemble_requirement
defined.documentation: Defines an experiment ensemble.

defined.name: ensemble_member
defined.documentation: Constraint on each ensemble member.

defined.name: ensemble_type
defined.documentation: Type of ensemble.

enumeration_members.documentation: Members differ in some aspects of their physics.
Members differ in how they are initialised.
Members initialised to sample possible initial conditions.
Members initialised at different starting dates.
Members have differing forcing data.
Members are/should-be run at different resolutions.
Members are/should-be driven by different models.

defined.name: minimum_size
defined.documentation: Minimum number of members.

defined.name: additional_requirements
defined.documentation: Additional detail for this requirement.

defined.name: is_conformance_info_required
defined.documentation: Indicator as to whether an institute is expected to provide informationas to how it confirmed.

defined.name: is_conformance_requested
defined.documentation: Indicator as to whether ensemble documentation should include conformance information for this requirement.

defined.name: scope
defined.documentation: Scope allows us to categorise a requirement in terms of how widely it is shared.

defined.name: forcing_constraint
defined.documentation: Identifies a model forcing constraint.

defined.name: additional_constraint
defined.documentation: Additional information, e.g. hold constant from 2100-01-01.

defined.name: category
defined.documentation: Category to which this belongs (from a CV, e.g. GASES).

defined.name: code
defined.documentation: Programme wide code from a controlled vocabulary (e.g. N2O).

defined.name: data_link
defined.documentation: A data record used by the forcing

defined.name: forcing_type
defined.documentation: Type of integration.

enumeration_members.documentation: Best estimates of actual state (included synthesized)
Simplified and/or exemplar, e.g. 1%C02
Intended to represent a possible future, e.g. RCP4.5
Driven from another simulation

defined.name: group
defined.documentation: Sub-Category (e.g. GHG).

defined.name: origin
defined.documentation: Pointer to origin, e.g. CMIP6 RCP database.

defined.name: additional_requirements
defined.documentation: Additional detail for this requirement.

defined.documentation: A numerical requirement associated with a numerical experiment.

defined.name: additional_requirements
defined.documentation: Additional detail for this requirement.

defined.name: is_conformance_info_required
defined.documentation: Indicator as to whether an institute is expected to provide informationas to how it confirmed.

defined.name: is_conformance_requested
defined.documentation: Indicator as to whether ensemble documentation should include conformance information for this requirement.

defined.name: scope
defined.documentation: Scope allows us to categorise a requirement in terms of how widely it is shared.

enumeration_members.documentation: MIP era wide e.g. 'concentration of pre-industrial CO2' & 'Impose AMIP SSTs'
Shared across a group of MIPs e.g. aerosol forcing in GeoMIP and AerChemMIP.
Shared within a single MIP e.g. spin-up protocol for land surface experiments in LUMIP.
Applies to a single experiment e.g. CFMIP 'zonally uniform SST plus 4K'

defined.name: alternative_names
defined.documentation: List of names by which the activity is also known.

defined.documentation: Community defined identifier or name.

defined.documentation: Time the activity was (or will be) active.

defined.documentation: A name used for internal purposes.

defined.documentation: User defined keywords.

defined.documentation: Provides details of what output is required and when from an experiment.

defined.documentation: Constraint on time or length of simulation.

defined.documentation: Amount of time before required start date that it is permissible to begin integration.

defined.name: drs_atomic_dataset
defined.documentation: An entity in a DRS file system.

defined.name: frequency
defined.documentation: Frequency at which data is stored.

enumeration_members.documentation: Yearly
Monthly
Daily
Every six hours
Every three hours
Sampling frequency less than an hour
Climatological Monthly Mean
Fixed Time independent

defined.name: geographical_constraint
defined.documentation: Identifies geographical subsets and spatial means.

defined.name: mip_table
defined.documentation: The MIP table, together with the variable defines the physical quantity.

defined.name: realm
defined.documentation: Modelling realm.

enumeration_members.documentation: Atmosphere
Ocean
Land
Land Ice
Sea Ice
Aerosol
Atmospheric Chemistry
Ocean Biogeochemistry

defined.name: temporal_constraint
defined.documentation: Identifies temporal subsets or means.

defined.name: variable_name
defined.documentation: Identifies the physical quantity (when used in conjunction with the MIP table).

defined.name: version_number
defined.documentation: Uniquely identifies a particular version of a publication level dataset.

defined.name: drs_ensemble_identifier
defined.documentation: Identifies a 'response ensemble' realisation using the semantic content ofa 'run_variant_id'.

defined.name: forcing_number
defined.documentation: Identifies possible perturbatinos in forcing.

defined.name: initialisation_method_number
defined.documentation: Identifies which method of initialisation was used, if multiple methods used.

defined.name: perturbation_number
defined.documentation: Identifies different members of a perturbed physics ensemble.

defined.name: realisation_number
defined.documentation: Standard ensemble axis realisation number (usually an initial condition ensemble).

defined.name: drs_experiment
defined.documentation: An encoding of a drs experiment_id.

defined.name: axis_identifer
defined.documentation: FIXME.

defined.name: axis_type
defined.documentation: Type of experimental family ensemble required.

enumeration_members.documentation: Members differ in some aspects of their physics.
Members differ in how they are initialised.
Members initialised to sample possible initial conditions.
Members initialised at different starting dates.
Members have differing forcing data.
Members are/should-be run at different resolutions.
Members are/should-be driven by different models.

defined.name: family
defined.documentation: Main experimental family.

defined.name: drs_geographical_indicator
defined.documentation:
Specifies geographical subsets described by bounding boxes or by named regions.
     One of spatial domain or bounding box must appear.

defined.name: bounding_box
defined.documentation: DRS bounding box of the form 'latJHJJHHlonMZMMZZ' where H, HH, Z, ZZ are from {NS} {EW} respectively.

defined.name: operator
defined.documentation: Spatial averagin applied to the geographical region.

enumeration_members.documentation: Data is zonally averaged
Data is zonally averaged over land in region
Data is zonally averaged over oceans in region
Data is averaged over the area of the region
Data is averaged over the land area of the region
Data is averaged over the ocean area of the region

defined.name: spatial_domain
defined.documentation: Geographical indicator (currently only 'global' is acceptable).

defined.name: drs_publication_dataset
defined.documentation: PLACEHOLDER for the real drs_publication_dataset.

defined.name: drs_simulation_identifier
defined.documentation: That part of the DRS which identifies the response to the experiment: the simulation.

defined.name: institute
defined.documentation: The institute responsible for this data entity.

defined.name: model
defined.documentation: A model identifier (sans blanks/periods and parenthesis).

defined.name: run_variant_id
defined.documentation: Also known as ensemble_identifier, unambiguously identifiers ensemble realisation information.

defined.name: drs_temporal_identifier
defined.documentation:
Provides information about temporal subsetting and/or averaging.
    If only N1 is present, it a temporal instant,
    If N1-N2 are present with no suffix, it is a temporal subset,
    If N1-N2 with a suffix are present, then some sort of temporal averaging has been applied across
    the period.

defined.name: end
defined.documentation: N2, required to indicate a period.

defined.name: start
defined.documentation: N1,  of the form yyyy[MM[dd[hh[mm[ss]]]]].

defined.name: suffix
defined.documentation: If present, used to indicate climatology or average.

enumeration_members.documentation: Indicates data is a single average of DRS frequency data across temporal period N1-N2
Indicates data is climatological average data at the DRS frequency from the period N1-N2

defined.name: component_performance
defined.documentation:
Describes the simulation rate of a model component.

Based on "CPMIP: Measurements of Real Computational Performance of
Earth System Models" (Balaji et. al. 2016, doi:10.5194/gmd-2016-197,
http://www.geosci-model-dev-discuss.net/gmd-2016-197/)

defined.name: component
defined.documentation: Link to a CIM software component description.

defined.name: actual_simulated_years_per_day
defined.documentation: Actual simulated years per day (ASYPD) in a 24h period on the given platform obtained from a typical long-running simulation with the model. Inclusive of system interruptions, queue wait time, or issues with the model workflow, etc.

defined.name: compiler
defined.documentation: Compiler used for performance test.

defined.name: complexity
defined.documentation: Complexity measured as the number of prognostic variables per component with an independent discretization

defined.name: core_hours_per_simulated_year
defined.documentation: Core-hours per simulated year (CHSY). This is measured as the product of the model runtime for 1 SY, and the numbers of cores allocated. Note that if allocations are done on a node basis then all cores on a node are charged against the allocation, regardless of whether or not they are used.

defined.name: coupling_cost
defined.documentation: Coupling cost measures the overhead caused by coupling. This can include the cost of the coupling algorithm itself (which may involve grid interpolation and computation of transfer coefficients for conservative coupling) as well as load imbalance. It is the normalized difference between the time-processor integral for the whole model versus the sum of individual concurrent components

defined.name: data_intensity
defined.documentation: Data intensity the amount of data produced per compute-hour, in units GB per compute-hour.

defined.name: data_output_cost
defined.documentation: Data output cost is the cost of performing I/O, and is the ratio of CHSY with and without I/O.

defined.name: joules_per_simulated_year
defined.documentation: The energy cost of a simulation, measured in joules per simulated year (JPSY). Given the energy E in joules consumed over a budgeting interval T (generally 1 month or 1 year, in units of hours), JPSY=CHSY*E*T/NP

defined.name: memory_bloat
defined.documentation: Memory bloat is the ratio of the actual memory size to the ideal memory size (the size of the complete model state, which in theory is all you need to hold in memory)Mi, defined below.

defined.name: meta
defined.documentation: Injected document metadata.

defined.name: model
defined.documentation: Model for which performance was tested.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Name for performance (experiment/test/whatever).

defined.name: parallelization
defined.documentation: Parallelization measured as the total number of cores (NP) allocated for the run, regardless of whether or or all cores were used. Note that NP=CHSY*SYPD/24.

defined.name: platform
defined.documentation: Platform on which performance was tested.

defined.name: resolution
defined.documentation: Resolution measured as the number of gridpoints (or more generally, spatial degrees of freedom) NX x NY x NZ per component with an independent discretization

defined.name: simulated_years_per_day
defined.documentation: Simulated years per day (SYPD) in a 24h period on the given platform

defined.name: subcomponent_performance
defined.documentation: Describes the performance of each subcomponent.

defined.name: compute_pool
defined.documentation: Homogeneous pool of nodes within a computing machine.

defined.name: accelerator_type
defined.documentation: Type of accelerator.

defined.name: accelerators_per_node
defined.documentation: Number of accelerator units on a node.

defined.name: clock_cycle_concurrency
defined.documentation: The number of operations which can be carried out concurrently in a single clock cycle of a single core. E.g. 4.

defined.name: clock_speed
defined.documentation: The clock speed of a single core, in units of GHz. E.g. 3.6.

defined.name: compute_cores_per_node
defined.documentation: Number of CPU cores per node.

defined.name: cpu_type
defined.documentation: CPU type.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Textural description of pool.

defined.name: interconnect
defined.documentation: Interconnect used.

defined.name: memory_per_node
defined.documentation: Memory per node.

defined.name: model_number
defined.documentation: Model/Board number/type.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Name of compute pool within a machine.

defined.name: number_of_nodes
defined.documentation: Number of nodes.

defined.name: operating_system
defined.documentation: Operating system.

defined.name: machine
defined.documentation: A computer/system/platform/machine which is used for simulation.

defined.name: meta
defined.documentation: Injected document metadata.

defined.name: compute_pools
defined.documentation: Layout of compute nodes.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Textural description of machine.

defined.name: institution
defined.documentation: Institutional location.

defined.name: model_number
defined.documentation: Vendor's model number/name - if it exists.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Name of partition (or machine).

defined.name: online_documentation
defined.documentation: Links to documentation.

defined.name: partition
defined.documentation: If machine is partitioned, treat subpartitions as machines.

defined.name: storage_pools
defined.documentation: Storage resource available.

defined.name: vendor
defined.documentation: The system integrator or vendor.

defined.name: when_used
defined.documentation: If no longer in use, the time period it was in use.

defined.name: partition
defined.documentation: A major partition (component) of a computing system (aka machine).

defined.name: compute_pools
defined.documentation: Layout of compute nodes.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Textural description of machine.

defined.name: institution
defined.documentation: Institutional location.

defined.name: model_number
defined.documentation: Vendor's model number/name - if it exists.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Name of partition (or machine).

defined.name: online_documentation
defined.documentation: Links to documentation.

defined.name: partition
defined.documentation: If machine is partitioned, treat subpartitions as machines.

defined.name: storage_pools
defined.documentation: Storage resource available.

defined.name: vendor
defined.documentation: The system integrator or vendor.

defined.name: when_used
defined.documentation: If no longer in use, the time period it was in use.

defined.name: performance
defined.documentation:
Describes the properties of a performance of a configured model on
a particular system/machine.

Based on "CPMIP: Measurements of Real Computational Performance of
Earth System Models" (Balaji et. al. 2016, doi:10.5194/gmd-2016-197,
http://www.geosci-model-dev-discuss.net/gmd-2016-197/)

Note that if allocations are done on a node basis then all cores on a node are charged against the allocation, regardless of whether or not they are used.

It is the normalized difference between the time-processor integral for the whole model versus the sum of individual concurrent components

defined.name: meta
defined.documentation: Injected document metadata.

defined.name: model
defined.documentation: Model for which performance was tested.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Name for performance (experiment/test/whatever).

defined.name: parallelization
defined.documentation: Parallelization measured as the total number of cores (NP) allocated for the run, regardless of whether or or all cores were used. Note that NP=CHSY*SYPD/24.

defined.name: platform
defined.documentation: Platform on which performance was tested.

defined.name: resolution
defined.documentation: Resolution measured as the number of gridpoints (or more generally, spatial degrees of freedom) NX x NY x NZ per component with an independent discretization

defined.name: simulated_years_per_day
defined.documentation: Simulated years per day (SYPD) in a 24h period on the given platform

defined.name: subcomponent_performance
defined.documentation: Describes the performance of each subcomponent.

defined.name: storage_pool
defined.documentation: Homogeneous storage pool on a computing machine.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Description of the technology used.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Name of storage pool.

defined.name: type
defined.documentation: Type of storage.

enumeration_members.documentation: Lustre parallel file system
IBM GPFS (also known as IBM Spectral Scale
The EMC scaleout NAS solution
Generic Network File System
Object file system exposing the AWS S3 interface
Panasas Parallel File system
Other disk based file system
Tape storage system using ECMWF MARS
Tape storage system using Met Office MASS
Tape storage sytsem using CERN Castor
Other tape based system

defined.name: vendor
defined.documentation: Vendor of storage hardware.

defined.name: storage_volume
defined.documentation: Platform storage volume and units.

defined.name: units
defined.documentation: Volume units.

enumeration_members.documentation: Gigabytes (1000^3)
Terabytes (1000^4)
Petabytes (1000^5)
Exabytes (1000^6)
Tebibytes (1024^4)
Pebibytes (1024^5)
Exbibytes (1024^6)

defined.name: volume
defined.documentation: Numeric value.

defined.name: model
defined.documentation:
A model component: can be executed standalone, and has as
    scientific description available via a link to a science.domain
    document. (A configured model can be understood in terms of a
    simulation, a model, and a configuration.).

defined.name: activity_properties
defined.documentation: Properties specific to the modelling activity in question, e.g. radiative forcing agents for CMIP6.

defined.name: coupled_components
defined.documentation: Software components which are linked together using a coupler to deliver this model.

defined.name: coupler
defined.documentation: Overarching coupling framework for model.

enumeration_members.documentation: The OASIS coupler - prior to OASIS-MCT
The MCT variant of the OASIS coupler
Vanilla Earth System Modelling Framework
National Unified Operational Prediction Capability variant of ESMF
Customised coupler developed for this model
It is not known what/if-a coupler is used
No coupler is used

defined.name: internal_software_components
defined.documentation: Software modules which together provide the functionality for this model.

defined.name: key_properties
defined.documentation: Model default key properties (may be over-ridden in coupled component and realm properties).

defined.name: meta
defined.documentation: Injected document metadata.

defined.name: model_type
defined.documentation: Generic type for this model.

enumeration_members.documentation: Atmosphere Only
Ocean Only
Regional Model
Earth System Model (Atmosphere, Ocean, Land, Sea-ice and cycles)
Global Climate Model (Atmosphere, Ocean, no carbon cycle)
Intermediate Complexity GCM
GCM with mixed layer ocean
Mesoscale Model
Limited Area process model
Non-Earth model

defined.name: realm_coupling
defined.documentation: Description of a coupling between realms

defined.name: realms
defined.documentation: The scientific realms which this model simulates internally, i.e. those which are not linked together using a coupler.

defined.name: canonical_id
defined.documentation: Vocabulary identifier, where this framework/component description was constructed via a controlled vocabulary.

defined.name: citations
defined.documentation: Set of pertinent citations.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Textural description of component.

defined.name: development_history
defined.documentation: History of the development of this component.

defined.name: long_name
defined.documentation: Long name for component.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Short name of component.

defined.name: release_date
defined.documentation: The date of publication of the component code (as opposed to the date of publication of the metadata document, or the date of deployment of the model).

defined.name: repository
defined.documentation: Location of code for this component.

defined.name: responsible_parties
defined.documentation: People or organisations responsible for providing this information.

defined.name: version
defined.documentation: Version identifier.

defined.name: realm
defined.documentation: Scientific area of a numerical model - usually a sub-model or component.

defined.name: canonical_name
defined.documentation: Canonical name for the realm.

defined.name: grid
defined.documentation: The grid used to layout the variables (e.g. the Global ENDGAME-grid).

defined.name: key_properties
defined.documentation: Realm key properties which differ from model defaults (grid, timestep etc).

defined.name: meta
defined.documentation: Injected document metadata.

defined.name: processes
defined.documentation: Processes simulated within the realm.

defined.name: software_frameworks
defined.documentation: Software framework(s) of the realm.

defined.name: citations
defined.documentation: Set of pertinent citations.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: A description (derived from specialization).

defined.name: keywords
defined.documentation: Keywords to help re-use and discovery of this information.

defined.name: overview
defined.documentation: An overview of topic being described.

defined.name: properties
defined.documentation: Set of associated specialized properties.

defined.name: property_sets
defined.documentation: Grouped specialized properties.

defined.name: responsible_parties
defined.documentation: People or organisations responsible for providing this information.

defined.name: short_name
defined.documentation: A short-name / key (derived from specialization).

defined.name: specialization_id
defined.documentation: Specialization identifier (derived from specialization).

defined.name: sub_topics
defined.documentation: Discrete sub-topic with details.

defined.name: realm_coupling
defined.documentation: Description of a coupling between realms.

defined.name: coupling_details
defined.documentation: Description of the coupling algorithm, and any other information (e.g. binlinear interpolation

defined.name: source_realm
defined.documentation: The model realm providing the variable (e.g. ocean)

defined.name: target_realm
defined.documentation: The model realm receiving the variable (e.g. atmosphere)

defined.name: time_frequency
defined.documentation: The time frequency of the coupling (e.g. 1 hour)

defined.name: variable
defined.documentation: The variable being coupled (e.g. 10 metre wind)

defined.name: topic
defined.documentation: An organized collection of details upon a specific topic, e.g. model key properties.

defined.name: citations
defined.documentation: Set of pertinent citations.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: A description (derived from specialization).

defined.name: keywords
defined.documentation: Keywords to help re-use and discovery of this information.

defined.name: overview
defined.documentation: An overview of topic being described.

defined.name: properties
defined.documentation: Set of associated specialized properties.

defined.name: property_sets
defined.documentation: Grouped specialized properties.

defined.name: responsible_parties
defined.documentation: People or organisations responsible for providing this information.

defined.name: short_name
defined.documentation: A short-name / key (derived from specialization).

defined.name: specialization_id
defined.documentation: Specialization identifier (derived from specialization).

defined.name: sub_topics
defined.documentation: Discrete sub-topic with details.

defined.name: topic_property
defined.documentation: A specialized question asked of the scientic community.

defined.name: qc_status
defined.documentation: Quality control status of entered values.

defined.name: specialization_id
defined.documentation: Specialization identifier (derived from specialization).

defined.name: values
defined.documentation: User value(s).

defined.name: topic_property_set
defined.documentation:
Provides specific details related to a topic (i.e. process, sub-process,
    grid, key properties, etc).

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: A description (derived from specialization).

defined.name: properties
defined.documentation: Set of associated specialized properties.

defined.name: short_name
defined.documentation: A short-name / key (derived from specialization).

defined.name: specialization_id
defined.documentation: Specialization identifier (derived from specialization).

defined.name: citation
defined.documentation: An academic reference to published work.

defined.name: abstract
defined.documentation: Abstract providing high level reference overview.

defined.name: citation_detail
defined.documentation: Complete citation string as would appear in a bibliography.

defined.name: collective_title
defined.documentation: Citation collective title, i.e. with all authors declared.

defined.name: context
defined.documentation: Brief text description of why this resource is being cited.

defined.name: doi
defined.documentation: Digital Object Identifier, if it exists.

defined.name: meta
defined.documentation: Injected document metadata.

defined.name: title
defined.documentation: Citation short title.

defined.name: type
defined.documentation: Citation type.

defined.name: url
defined.documentation: Location of electronic version.

defined.name: doc_meta_info
defined.documentation:
Encapsulates document meta information used by es-doc machinery. Will not normally be
    populated by humans. May duplicate information held in 'visible' metadata.

defined.name: author
defined.documentation: Author of the metadata in the parent document.

defined.name: create_date
defined.documentation: Date upon which the instance was created.

defined.name: drs_keys
defined.documentation: DRS related keys to support correlation of documents with datasets.

defined.name: drs_path
defined.documentation: DRS related path to support documents with datasets.

defined.name: external_ids
defined.documentation: Set of identifiers used to reference the document by external parties.

defined.name: id
defined.documentation: Universal document identifier (must be a valid UUID).

defined.name: institute
defined.documentation: Name of institute with which instance is associated.

defined.name: project
defined.documentation: Name of project with which instance is associated.

defined.name: sort_key
defined.documentation: Document sort key.

defined.name: source
defined.documentation: Name of application that created the instance.

defined.name: source_key
defined.documentation: Key of application that created the instance.

defined.name: sub_projects
defined.documentation: Set of sub-projects with which instance is associated.

defined.name: type
defined.documentation: Document ontology type key.

defined.name: type_display_name
defined.documentation: Document type display name.

defined.name: type_sort_key
defined.documentation: Document type sort key.

defined.name: update_date
defined.documentation: Date upon which the instance was last updated.

defined.name: version
defined.documentation: Document version identifier.

defined.name: doc_reference
defined.documentation: A reference to another cim entity.

defined.name: canonical_name
defined.documentation: Canonical name given to document.

defined.name: constraint_vocabulary
defined.documentation: A constraint vocabulary for the relationship.

defined.name: context
defined.documentation: Information about remote record in context of reference.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Detail of how to access the resource.

defined.name: external_id
defined.documentation: External identifier of remote resource, if known.

defined.name: further_info
defined.documentation: A further piece of information used in ad-hoc contexts.

defined.name: id
defined.documentation: Identifier of remote resource, if known.

defined.name: institute
defined.documentation: Canonical institute name of referenced document.

defined.name: linkage
defined.documentation: A URL.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: A user friendly name given to document.

defined.name: protocol
defined.documentation: Protocol to use at the linkage.

defined.name: relationship
defined.documentation: Relationship of the object target as seen from the subject resource.

defined.name: type
defined.documentation: The type of remote document.

defined.name: url
defined.documentation: The URL of the remote document.

defined.name: version
defined.documentation: The version of the remote document.

defined.name: extra_attribute
defined.documentation:
An extra attribute with key and value needed to encode further information
    not in the CIM2 domain model or specialisation. Typical use case: in parsing
    data and encoding attributes found in data.

defined.name: doc
defined.documentation: Documentation associated with this key.

defined.name: key
defined.documentation: Name of attribute.

defined.name: type
defined.documentation: If a non-string type, provide type.

defined.name: value
defined.documentation: Value associated with key.

defined.name: online_resource
defined.documentation:
A minimal approximation of ISO19115 CI_ONLINERESOURCE, provides a link and details
    of how to use that link.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Detail of how to access the resource.

defined.name: linkage
defined.documentation: A URL.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Name of online resource.

defined.name: protocol
defined.documentation: Protocol to use at the linkage.

defined.name: party
defined.documentation:
Implements minimal material for an ISO19115-1 (2014) compliant party.
    For our purposes this is a much better animal than the previous responsibleParty 
    which munged roles together with people. Note we have collapsed CI_Contact,
    CI_Individual and CI_Organisation as well as the abstract CI_Party.

defined.name: address
defined.documentation: Institutional address.

defined.name: email
defined.documentation: Email address.

defined.name: is_organisation
defined.documentation: True if an organisation not a person.

defined.name: meta
defined.documentation: Injected document metadata.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Name of person or organisation.

defined.name: orcid_id
defined.documentation: Orcid ID if available.

defined.name: url
defined.documentation: URL of person or institution.

defined.name: quality_review
defined.documentation: Assertions as to the completeness and quality of a document.

defined.name: date
defined.documentation: Date upon which review was made.

defined.name: meta
defined.documentation: Injected document metadata.

defined.name: metadata_reviewer
defined.documentation: Party who made the metadata quality assessment.

defined.name: quality_description
defined.documentation: Assessment of quality of target document.

defined.name: quality_status
defined.documentation: Status from a controlled vocabulary.

enumeration_members.documentation: Currently being worked on
Author has completed document, prior to review
Document is being reviewed
Document has been formally reviewed and assessed as complete and accurate

defined.name: target_document
defined.documentation: This is the document about which quality is asserted.

defined.name: responsibility
defined.documentation:
Implements the ISO19115-1 (2014) CI_Responsibility (which replaces
    responsibleParty). Combines a person and their role in doing something.

defined.name: parties
defined.documentation: Parties delivering responsibility.

defined.name: role
defined.documentation: Role that the party plays or played.

enumeration_members.documentation: Key party responsible for the existence of the resource
Original source for the resource if obtained from elsewhere
Party who created (or co-created) resource
Contributor to the production of the resource
Party who published the resource
Party with legal ownership of the resource
Party who has taken part in the workflow that resulted in this resource
Party who distributes the resource
Party who has invested in the production of the resource
Party who uses the resource
Party who can be contacted for acquiring knowledge about or acquisition of the resource
Party that supplies the resource
Party that accepts accountability and responsibility for the source resource
Party who carried out an independent review of (this) documentation
Party who created (this) documentation

defined.name: when
defined.documentation: Period when role was active, if no longer.

defined.name: text_blob
defined.documentation:
Provides a text class which supports plaintext, html, and
    friends (or will do).

defined.name: content
defined.documentation: Raw content (including markup).

defined.name: encoding
defined.documentation: Content encoding.

enumeration_members.documentation: Normal plain text

defined.name: composition
defined.documentation:
Describes how component variables are coupled together either to/from other
    SoftwareComponents or external data files. The variables specified by a component's
    composition must be owned by that component, or a  child of that component;
    child components cannot couple together parent variables.

defined.name: couplings
defined.documentation: #FIXME.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: #FIXME.

defined.name: development_path
defined.documentation: Describes the software development path for this model/component.

defined.name: consortium_name
defined.documentation: If model/component is developed as part of a consortium, provide consortium name.

defined.name: creators
defined.documentation: Those responsible for creating this component.

defined.name: funding_sources
defined.documentation: The entities that funded this software component.

defined.name: previous_version
defined.documentation: Name of a previous version.

defined.name: was_developed_in_house
defined.documentation: Model or component was mostly developed in house.

defined.name: entry_point
defined.documentation:
Describes a function or subroutine of a SoftwareComponent.
    BFG will use these EntryPoints to define a schedule of subroutine calls for a coupled model.
    Currently, a very basic schedule can be approximated by using the 'proceeds' and 'follows' attributes,
    however a more complete system is required for full BFG compatibility.
    Every EntryPoint can have a set of arguments associated with it.
    These reference (previously defined) variables.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: #FIXME.

defined.name: gridspec
defined.documentation: Fully defines the computational grid used.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Textural description.

defined.name: implementation
defined.documentation:
Implementation information for a software framework/component, whether a top level model,
    or a specific piece of code known as a 'component'. In software terms, a
    software framework/component is a discrete set of code that takes input data and generates output data.
    Software frameworks/components may or may not have scientific descriptions.

defined.name: canonical_id
defined.documentation: Vocabulary identifier, where this framework/component description was constructed via a controlled vocabulary.

defined.name: citations
defined.documentation: Set of pertinent citations.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Textural description of framework/component.

defined.name: development_history
defined.documentation: History of the development of this framework/component.

defined.name: long_name
defined.documentation: Long name for framework/component.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Short name of framework/component.

defined.name: release_date
defined.documentation: The date of publication of the framework/component code.

defined.name: repository
defined.documentation: Location of code for this framework/component.

defined.name: version
defined.documentation: Version identifier.

defined.name: software_component
defined.documentation:
An embedded piece of software that does not normally function as a standalone model (although
    it may be used standalone in a test harness).

defined.name: composition
defined.documentation: #FIXME.

defined.name: connection_points
defined.documentation: The set of data entities which are available for I/O and/or coupling.

defined.name: coupling_framework
defined.documentation: The coupling framework that this entire component conforms to.

enumeration_members.documentation: The OASIS coupler - prior to OASIS-MCT
The MCT variant of the OASIS coupler
Vanilla Earth System Modelling Framework
National Unified Operational Prediction Capability variant of ESMF
Customised coupler developed for this model
It is not known what/if-a coupler is used
No coupler is used

defined.name: dependencies
defined.documentation: #FIXME.

defined.name: depends_on
defined.documentation: The software components whose outputs are inputs to this software component.

defined.name: grid
defined.documentation: A reference to the grid that is used by this component.

defined.name: language
defined.documentation: Language the component is written in.

enumeration_members.documentation: Fortran Programming Language
C Programmming Language
C++ Programming Language
Python Programming Language

defined.name: license
defined.documentation: The license held by this piece of software.

defined.name: sub_components
defined.documentation: Internal software sub-components of this component.

defined.name: canonical_id
defined.documentation: Vocabulary identifier, where this framework/component description was constructed via a controlled vocabulary.

defined.name: citations
defined.documentation: Set of pertinent citations.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Textural description of component.

defined.name: development_history
defined.documentation: History of the development of this component.

defined.name: long_name
defined.documentation: Long name for component.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Short name of component.

defined.name: release_date
defined.documentation: The date of publication of the component code (as opposed to the date of publication of the metadata document, or the date of deployment of the model).

defined.name: repository
defined.documentation: Location of code for this component.

defined.name: responsible_parties
defined.documentation: People or organisations responsible for providing this information.

defined.name: version
defined.documentation: Version identifier.

defined.name: variable
defined.documentation:
An instance of a model software variable which may be prognostic or diagnostic, and which is
    available as a connection to other software components. Note that these variables may only exist
    within the software workflow as interim quantities or coupling endpoints. Input and output
    variables will be a subset of these software variables.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Description of how the variable is being used in the s/w.

defined.name: is_prognostic
defined.documentation: Whether or not prognostic or diagnostic.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Short name for the variable.

defined.name: calendar
defined.documentation:
Describes the calendar required/used in an experiment/simulation.
    This class is based on the calendar attributes and properties found in the
    CF netCDF conventions.

defined.name: description
defined.documentation: Extra information about the calendar.

defined.name: month_lengths
defined.documentation: Used for special calendars to provide month lengths.

defined.name: name
defined.documentation: Can be used to name a special calendar type.

defined.name: standard_name
defined.documentation: Type of calendar used.

enumeration_members.documentation: Mixed Gregorian/Julian calendar as defined by Udunits
Synonym for gregorian: Mixed Gregorian/Julian calendar as defined by Udunits
A Gregorian calendar extended to dates before 1582-10-15. That is, a year is a leap year if either (i) it is divisible by 4 but not by 100 or (ii) it is divisible by 400.
Gregorian calendar without leap years, i.e., all years are 365 days long.
Synonym for noleap:Gregorian calendar without leap years, i.e., all years are 365 days long.
Gregorian calendar with every year being a leap year, i.e., all years are 366 days long.
Synonym for all_leap:Gregorian calendar with every year being a leap year, i.e., all years are 366 days long.
All years are 360 days divided into 30 day months.
Julian Calendar
Perpetual time axis

defined.name: date_time
defined.documentation:
A date or time. Either in simulation time with the simulation
    calendar, or with reference to a simulation start, in which
    case the datetime is an interval after the start date.

defined.name: is_offset
defined.documentation: Date is offset from start of an integration.

defined.name: value
defined.documentation: Date or time - some of (from left to right): yyyy-mm-dd:hh:mm:ss.

defined.name: irregular_dateset
defined.documentation:
A set of irregularly spaced times, provided as a comma separated string of yyyy-mm-dd in
     the appropriate calendar.

defined.name: date_set
defined.documentation: Set of dates, comma separated yyyy-mm-dd.

defined.name: length
defined.documentation: Number of times in set.

defined.name: regular_timeset
defined.documentation: A regularly spaced set of times.

defined.name: increment
defined.documentation: Interval between members of set.

defined.name: length
defined.documentation: Number of times in set.

defined.name: start_date
defined.documentation: Beginning of time set.

defined.name: length
defined.documentation: Number of times in set.

defined.name: time_period
defined.documentation: A time period/interval (aka temporal extent).

defined.name: calendar
defined.documentation: Calendar, default is standard aka gregorian.

defined.name: date
defined.documentation: Optional start/end date of time period.

defined.name: date_type
defined.documentation: Describes how the date is used to define the period.

enumeration_members.documentation: Date is not used
The date defines the start of the period
The date is the end of the period

defined.name: length
defined.documentation: Duration of the time period.

defined.name: units
defined.documentation: Appropriate time units.

enumeration_members.documentation: Years in current calendar
Months in the current calendar
86400 seconds
Standard metric seconds
